Hutchinson, 1959.

Intention, Oxford: Basil Blackwell, 1957; 2nd
edition, 1963.

Three Philosophers: Aristotle, Aquinas, Frege, with Peter
Geach, Oxford: Basil Blackwell, 2002.

Descartes, René, Philosophical Writings,
translated by G. E. M. Anscombe and Peter Geach, London: Thomas Nelson
and Sons, 1954.

Wittgenstein, Ludwig, Philosophical Investigations,
translated by G. E. M. Anscombe, Oxford: Basil Blackwell, 1953.

Wittgenstein, Ludwig, Notebooks 1914–1916, translated by
G. E. M. Anscombe, Oxford: Basil Blackwell, 1961.

–––. On Certainty, translated by Denis

–––. Remarks on the Foundation of

–––. Zettel, translated by G. E. M.
Anscombe, Oxford: Blackwell, 1967.

Bennett, Jonathan, 1966. “Whatever the Consequences,”

–––, 1995. The Act Itself, Oxford:
Oxford University Press.

Boyle, Joseph, 1980.  “Toward Understanding the Principle of

Bratman, Michael, 1987. Intention, Plans, and Practical

Davidson, Donald, 1963. “Actions, Reasons, and Causes ”

2009. Cogniton, 111: 364–371.

Monk, Ray, 1991. Ludwig Wittgenstein: The Duty of
